parameters.text:
=Generate the keywords that will be used in this "Angel Investor Canvas", it's like a "Business Model Canvas" so it's based on just keywords or short phrases (usually less than 30 characters).

Generate the keywords for each of these 12 areas, based on the answers provided by the angel investor down below. Make sure that the keywords of each area are always between 10 and 60 characters long.

Make the output look like a excel format, following this format: Name | Email | Phone | Date | Goals | Market Vision | Market Needs | Involvement Profile | Commitment | Added Value | Investment Profile | Investment Plan | Portfolio Plan | Startup Profile | Verticals & Geographies | Business Models

Make sure that the keywords of each area are always between 10 and 60 characters long.

Make sure that the keywords of each area always between 10 and 60 characters long.

Make sure to export the date using the format example: 01-Ene-2020

{{ $json['Canvas Prompts'] }}

Turn it into a json file. 

Make sure to space the keywords properly with space and commas.

Make sure that the keywords of each area are always between 10 and 60 characters long.

MAKE SURE TO ELIMINATE ANY SPECIAL CHARACTERS

ANGEL INVESTORS ANSWERS:

{{ $('Text with angel responses').item.json["Angel Responses"] }}
Make sure that the keywords of each area are always between 10 and 60 characters long.

=Take the following "INVESTOR ADVICE" and the following ANSWERS from the ANGEL CANVAS to generate the advice of what type of investment works best for this investor based on his answers. Generate maximum three pros and three cons of his investor type, based on the answers provided.

Format it as a letter written to the person, starting with "Dear {{ $('Set Fields').item.json.Name.split(' ')[0] }},
[Add two Line spaces]
Based on your angel investing preferences and my experience helping investors like you, I believe that being...".
MAKE SURE TO ONLY RECOMMEND ONE TYPE OF INVESTOR TYPE, DON'T MENTION ANYTHING ABOUT COMPLEMENTING OR MIXING INVESTMENT STRATEGIES. JUST EXPLAIN IN A SUMMARIZED WAY IN BETWEEN 50 TO 80 ADDITIONAL CHARACTERS, WHY HIS PREFERENCES ALIGN WITH THAT INVESTOR TYPE.
[Add one line space]
Pros
Turn the pros into bulletpoints, each bullet point is between 40 to 50 characters long. MAKE SURE TO ADD A BULLT POINT SYMBOL GLYPH at the beginning of each bullet point "•". Only add 3 pros.

Cons
Turn the cons into bulletpoints, each bullet point is between 40 to 50 characters long. MAKE SURE TO ADD A BULLT POINT SYMBOL GLYPH at the beginning of each bullet point "•". Only add 3 cons.

Then close with a paragrahp with personalized advice taking between 220 and 300 characters with the following details:

{{ $json['Advice Prompts'] }}

INVESTOR ADVICE HERE:

Do the whole letter in between 500 to 600 characters.
Do the whole letter in between 500 to 600 characters.
Do the whole letter in between 500 to 600 characters.

THE ROLES FOR THE INVESTOR ADVICE:
{{ $('Aggregated Matrix Advice').item.json.data.toJsonString() }}
Investor Types and Personalized Advice Framework:

1. Angel Fund  

    Pros :
	Involvement with flexibility
	Networking 
	Best early-stage deal-flow
	Professional management
	Learn from experienced angels
	Diversification 
	Discuss decisions 
         
    Cons :
	Might have less independence
	A bit of less control
	Could have longer lock-in
	Could count with management fees
         
    Best For :
        Investors who want to get involved sometimes but can rely on a group when needed. Investors who value diversification and want a professional team but don't want to delegate the entire process.
        Choose an Angel Fund if you want diversification and professional oversight but don’t want to delegate completely losing the opportunity to engage with startups directly.


2. Solo Angel  

    Pros :
	Direct relationship with founders
	More independency
	Full control
	Flexible ticket size
	More involvement with ecosystem
    Cons :
        Workload, time commitment and costs
	Highest risk and limited diversification
	Need more money available
	Limited deal access
	Statistically lowers returns
	Knowledge requirements
    Best For :
        Experienced angels who are very confident in deciding alone, want to get hands-on, and have significant time available. Go Solo if you want full control, direct relationships, and are confident in your investing skills.
    Customized Message :
        "You’ve built a strong intuition and track record investing on your own, but even the best solo angels eventually hit the limits of time and diversification. Consider an angel fund if you find it important to leverage your experience without burning out. An angel fund gives you access to a professionally managed, diversified portfolio and frees up your time to focus on the deals or sectors you're truly passionate about. It’s not about giving up control; it’s about amplifying your impact."
         

3. Small Angel Vehicle (Friends)  

    Pros :
	With friends - trust
	Shared decision and due dilligence
	Pooling capital increased ticket size
	Significant involvement
    Cons :
	High risk-low diversification
	No professional team
	Potential for conflicts, friendship risks
	Informal governance
    Best For :
        Close-knit, aligned investors who want more leverage but not formal structure.
        Invest with Friends if you trust each other and want to share risk/effort without formalizing too much.
         
    Customized Message :
        "Investing with friends has its rewards, but it also has its limits, both in deal access and decision-making. An angel fund can complement your group's strategy by exposing you to larger, more competitive deals, with none of the admin headaches. You still get to learn and share insights together, but with the backing of a dedicated team curating and managing a diversified pipeline."
         
     

4. Angel Syndicate (Club/Network)  

    Pros :
	Events
	Training opportunities
	Networking
	Shared due diligence
	Access to vetted deals
	Low effort per deal
         
    Cons :
	Risk of treating startups as entertainment
	More social club than investment 
	Not professional in most syndicates
	Fees & carry to lead investor
	Less control
	Decisions may be rushed
         
    Best For :
        Busy professionals and inexperienced angels who prefer passive involvement with vetted access to deals.
        Join a Syndicate if you want access to quality deals and community input with minimal effort.
         
    Customized Message :
        "You already appreciate the power of collective intelligence and deal curation; now imagine that at scale, with a professional team managing portfolio construction, follow-ons, and exits. Angel funds are the next step if you want broader exposure without spending more time. You can still co-invest in your favorite deals while building a stronger, safer base."

5. VC Fund  

    Pros :
	Convenience
	Professional management
	Institutional-grade due diligence
	Follow-on power
	Diversification 
         
    Cons :
	No involvement 
	No independence or control
	High minimum investment commitment
	Illiquidity
	Management fees and Carry
         
    Best For :
        Accredited high net worth investors, looking for exposure to high-growth companies with a hands-off approach.
        Commit to a VC Fund if you want to go big and can afford long-term, illiquid investments with higher minimums and prefer delegating to a management team over getting involved with startups directly.
         
    Customized Message :
        "If you’re looking for more than just quarterly reports, an angel fund gives you something a VC fund can’t: a seat at the table. You’ll have the opportunity to actively participate in investment decisions, engage directly with founders, and immerse yourself in the early-stage ecosystem — all while benefiting from the structure and diversification of a professionally managed fund. It’s the best of both worlds: the strategic exposure of a VC fund, with the hands-on engagement and learning of an angel. Ideal for investors who want to stay sharp, expand their network, and shape the future, not just watch from the sidelines."
         
Do the whole letter in between 500 to 600 characters.
Do the whole letter in between 500 to 600 characters.
Do the whole letter in between 500 to 600 characters.

REMOVE ANY SPECIAL CHARACTERS FROM THE FINAL OUTPUT.

ANGEL CANVAS ANSWERS TO CUSTOMIZE YOUR ADVICE:
What's my previous experience investing in startups?
{{ $('Set Fields').item.json.Experience }}
How much time do I want to dedicate to angel investing?
Answer: {{ $('Set Fields').item.json.Commitment }}
How much would I be comfortable investing?
Answer: {{ $('Set Fields').item.json["Investment Plan"] }}
How many startups would I like to invest on?
{{ $('Set Fields').item.json["Portfolio Plan"] }}

parameters.subject: =Dear {{ $('Set Fields').item.json.Name.split(' ')[0] }}, here’s your Angel Canvas gift as I promised
parameters.message:
=I crafted it based on your unique path and personal preferences to help you on your investor journey.

I’ve added it to your personal Angel Journey Folder, along with a letter for you and a list of costly mistakes you must avoid in 2025.

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/{{ $('Create Folder: NAME - Angel Investor Journey').item.json.id }}

I would appreciate it if you share with me your honest feedback, as I’m on a mission to help 100 thousand angels like you all over the world.

Seriously, tell me at least one thing we can do to improve it, and turn it into something your network could really appreciate.

Text me on whatsapp if that’s easier for you https://wa.me/351916690277

Best,
Pedro Bandeira
YAngel CEO

parameters.text:
=TURN THE TEXT INTO 4 PARAGRAHPS OF SIMILAR SIZE SEPARATED BY A LINE SPACE.
TURN THE TEXT INTO 4 PARAGRAHPS OF SIMILAR SIZE SEPARATED BY A LINE SPACE.
TURN THE TEXT INTO 4 PARAGRAHPS OF SIMILAR SIZE SEPARATED BY A LINE SPACE.

HERE ARE THEANGEL CANVAS ANSWERS TO MATCH THE ADVICE YOU WILL FIND:

Time available
Answer: {{ $('Set Fields').item.json.Commitment }}

Amount to invest
Answer: {{ $('Set Fields').item.json["Investment Plan"] }}

# of startups
Answer: {{ $('Set Fields').item.json["Portfolio Plan"] }}

Previous experience investing in startups:
Answer: {{ $('Set Fields').item.json.Experience }}

HERE IS THE ADVICE MATRIX WHERE YOU WILL FIND THE ADVICE YOU WILL OUTPUT:
{{ $('Aggregated Matrix Advice').item.json.data.toJsonString() }}

MAKE SURE TO FULLY SEARCH THE ADVICE MATRIX UNTIL YOU FIND A SAMPLE THAT MATCHES THE EXACTLY SAME "Time available", "# of startups" and "Amount to invest" values

MAKE SURE TO FULLY SEARCH THE ADVICE MATRIX UNTIL YOU FIND A SAMPLE THAT MATCHES THE EXACTLY SAME "Time available", "# of startups" and "Amount to invest" values

MAKE SURE TO FULLY SEARCH THE ADVICE MATRIX UNTIL YOU FIND A SAMPLE THAT MATCHES THE EXACTLY SAME "Time available", "# of startups" and "Amount to invest" values

MAKE SURE THE OUTPUT DOESN'T EXCEED 1300 CHARACTERS.
MAKE SURE THE OUTPUT DOESN'T EXCEED 1300 CHARACTERS.
MAKE SURE THE OUTPUT DOESN'T EXCEED 1300 CHARACTERS.

=Take the following text and based on the text determine the type of investor that's being adviced to take, among these 6 options.

1. "Angel Fund"
2. "Solo Angel"
3. "Small Angel Vehicle"
4. "Angel Syndicate"
5. "VC fund"
6. "Crowdfunding"

Make sure to only output one specific type of investor. Use one of the six specific types I just shared you. 

Here is the advice: {{ $('Advice Letter Agent P2').item.json.output }}

parameters.message:
=We built the Angel Canvas to support angel investors in making better decisions, and it keeps getting better thanks to the suggestions from people like you.

We are confident it’ll help your network too.

You can now share it to help a current or aspiring angel.

Angel Canvas Gift Link
https://tally.so/r/n9MY2V

You can also get a personalized gift card to share with a group or someone specific.

Get Custom Gift Card
https://wa.me/573012748971?text=Get+Custom+Gift+Card

Best,
Pedro Bandeira
YAngel CEO

parameters.textBody:
✨Easter Egg Discovered✨
Type "Gift" to get a custom Gift Card.

Got it. What’s the name of the person or group you want to gift it to?

Example:
-Simon Sinek
-Stanford MBA Alumni

I will help you create your own Angel Canvas Gift Card, like this one. 

Tell me your first and last name.
Ok, I'm creating it. Hold on 20 sec.
